intro: Dipyrena dentata, commonly known as the toothed dipyrena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Dipyrena dentata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks.
